intro: Silene hellmannii, commonly known as the Hellmann's campion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are often arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Silene hellmannii is a perennial species that is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
